snippet: The Supreme Court found that flooding did not have to be permanent for Arkansas to seek federal compensation over dam releases.
abstract: Supreme Court rules that people whose property was damaged by intermittent flooding caused by government may seek compensation; unanimous decision reverses a lower court ruling that had barred claims for flood damage unless the flooding was permanent or recurring; case arose from activities of Army Corps of Engineers.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court found that flooding did not have to be permanent for Arkansas to seek federal compensation over dam releases.

headline.seo: Justices Allow Damage Claims Over Periodic Flooding
headline.main: Justices Broaden the Basis for Damages Over Floods
headline.print_headline: Justices Broaden the Basis For Damages Over Floods
